titles.title: Consumer Travel Tax Credit Holiday Act of 2001
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to provide a credit against income tax for costs of travel for purposes of making retail purchases in States that do not impose sales tax.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

bill.summary: 11/29/2001--Introduced. Consumer Travel Tax Credit Holiday Act of 2001 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to allow an individual a credit for qualified travel expenses incurred from December 7, 2001 through December 16, 2001. Restricts such expenses to travel and lodging costs in connection with trips to Alaska, Delaware, Montana, New Hampshire, or Oregon (non-sales tax States).
